# Museum of Outstanding Figures of Ukrainian Culture

| embedded        =  (House where the poet and public figure Lesya Ukrainka lived) |designation1_type = History |designation1_number = 260043-Н}}
}}
The Museum of Outstanding Figures of Ukrainian Culture () is one of the museums in Kyiv, Ukraine, dedicated to prominent Ukrainian Culture celebrities: Lesia Ukrainka, Mykola Lysenko, Panas Saksagansky, Mykhailo Starytsky.
It was founded in 1987. The reason to create this museum space was that in the late 19th – early 20th centuries at this area lived the families of such Ukrainian Culture celebrities as Lesia Ukrainka, Mykola Lysenko, Panas Saksagansky and Mykhailo Starytsky.
The memorial buildings have been preserved till now; they are natural borders of the museum's territory. Each of these houses has an exposition depicting the life and creative activities of the celebrity.
In December 2022, the original manuscript of Shchedryk by Mykola Leontovych was exhibited for the first time at this museum.
Sources
* Museums of Kyiv. Guide-book, 2005. - P. 51

Терехова та інші]. — К. : Кий, 2007. — 144 с. : ілюстрації. — 1000 примірників.
